articles.author: Kevin Yao, Samuel Shen
articles.description: China's promised "basket of measures" to defuse local government debt risks is likely to include special bond issuance, debt swaps, loan rollovers, and something Beijing really loathes: dipping into the central budget.
articles.title: China can no longer 'extend and pretend' on municipal debt

articles.author: Brigid Riley
articles.description: Japanese authorities are unlikely to intervene in foreign exchange markets to prop up the yen as the currency has already found some support and will head much higher as U.S. interest rates peak, former finance official Eisuke Sakakibara said.
articles.title: Japan's 'Mr.Yen' Sakakibara expects no yen intervention

articles.author: Mark John
articles.description: A global failure to curb carbon emissions will lead to rising debt-servicing costs for 59 nations within the next decade, according to a study that simulated the economic impact of climate change on current sovereign credit ratings.
articles.title: Climate change puts sovereigns at downgrade risk, study finds

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Paytm's (PAYT.NS) founder and CEO, Vijay Shekhar Sharma, will buy a 10.3% stake valued at $628 million in the company from its largest shareholder, in a bid to simplify its ownership structure, the fintech company said in a filing on Monday.
articles.title: Paytm CEO Sharma to buy stake worth $628 mln in co from Antfin Holding

articles.author: Rae Wee
articles.description: The dollar was on the back foot on Monday after a mixed U.S. jobs report provided little directional conviction and as market focus turned to inflation data from the world's two largest economies due this week.
articles.title: Dollar tentative as US inflation data looms

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. trucking firm Yellow Corp (YELL.O) filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection on Sunday, burdened with a heavy debt load after a series of mergers and following tense contract negotiations with the Teamsters Union.
articles.title: US trucking firm Yellow files for bankruptcy after loading up on debt

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Shares in Hua Hong Semiconductor, China's second largest chip foundry, opened up 13% in its Shanghai debut on Monday, after the company raised $3 billion in China's biggest public offering so far this year.
articles.title: China chipmaker Hua Hong opens sharply up in Shanghai debut after $3 bln offering

articles.author: Pavel Polityuk
articles.description: Ukraine said Russia bombed a blood transfusion centre near the front line in a wave of air strikes overnight while Moscow reported that it had shot down a drone heading to the capital on Sunday in the third such attack in a week.
articles.title: Russia launches burst of missile and drone attacks, Ukraine says

articles.author: Susan Heavey, Kanishka Singh
articles.description: Donald Trump on Sunday targeted the federal judge assigned to the case charging him with seeking to overturn the 2020 presidential election, as his lawyer argued that actions Trump took after his loss were just "asks."
articles.title: Trump targets DC judge in 2020 election case

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Daimler Truck's (DTGGe.DE) Chief Financial Officer Jochen Goetz has died in a "tragic accident," the company said on Sunday.
articles.title: Daimler Truck CFO Jochen Goetz dies in 'tragic accident'
